page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY,MARCHWOOD
page.content: The area mostly consists of agricultural land,and is used mainly for {dairy farming.}Some quite large areas of woodland are found, mainly in the far North West and South East corners.A small corner of the New Forest extends into the area,mostly consisting of well grazed rough grassland. Most of the population live in the village of{Marchwood...about 4000 in 1985.It is not a very old village.The oldest building is a farm which dates from the early 17th century.The village is growing rapidly and a new shopping centre is being built to serve the several new estates. A small corner of the much older village of Dibden is in the far South of the area.It includes the old medieval church.
